parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>The post includes a CMF number (CMF11240003) at the end. This strongly suggests it is electoral propaganda, as CMF numbers are used for tracking campaign finance and are mandated for political advertising.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>The post explicitly mentions "Pop Sebastian Tiberiu" as a candidate for the Chamber of Deputies for the PNCR (Partidul Național Conservator Român). This clearly identifies a parliamentary candidate and fulfills the criteria of Article 36 (7) - a.</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>As a paid Facebook post, this content is designed to reach a wide audience, not just a select few.  The use of hashtags further amplifies its public reach. This satisfies the condition of Article 36 (7) - c.</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>The post's primary objective is to promote Pop Sebastian Tiberiu's candidacy and his legislative initiative focused on civic education. While the initiative itself is not inherently electoral, its presentation within the context of a political campaign clearly aims to influence voters' choices.  The hashtags such as #PutereaVotului (The Power of the Vote) and #TineriiVotează (Youth Votes) directly encourage voting. This fulfills the criteria of Article 36 (7) - c.</electoral-objective>
<journalism>Although the post discusses civic education, it's presented as part of a political campaign. The information provided is not presented in a neutral journalistic style; rather, it's framed to highlight the candidate's platform and encourage support.  It lacks the objectivity expected of journalistic content.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>The content is not a personal opinion; it's a structured presentation of a political platform designed to garner votes. The inclusion of the candidate's name, party affiliation, and call to action removes any ambiguity about its purpose.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>937272021083576</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The post fulfills all the criteria for electoral propaganda as defined by Article 36 (7) of LEGE nr. 334 din 17 iulie 2006. It refers to a specific parliamentary candidate (Pop Sebastian Tiberiu), targets a wide audience through a paid Facebook campaign, and has the clear objective of influencing voters' choices in the upcoming elections. The presence of a CMF number further confirms its nature as political advertising.  The post's content, while discussing civic education, is presented within a campaign framework, lacking the neutrality expected of journalistic or educational material.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>TRUE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates>
  <candidate> <name>Pop Sebastian Tiberiu</name><impact>POSITIVE</impact></candidate>
</electoral-propaganda-candidates>
<responsible-party-or-group>PNCR</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police>
[Entitatea responsabilă], pentru încălcarea articolului 98 t) din LEGEA nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015, prin publicarea unei postări pe Facebook (ID: 937272021083576) după ora 18:00 pe 23.11.2024, care promovează candidatura lui Pop Sebastian Tiberiu pentru Camera Deputaților din partea PNCR. Postarea, care a beneficiat de o investiție financiară de sub 100 RON, a atins o audiență de peste 1 milion de persoane, utilizând hashtag-uri precum #PutereaVotului și #TineriiVotează pentru a influența votul.  Prezența numărului CMF11240003 confirmă natura sa de propagandă electorală. Conținutul, deși abordează educația civică, este prezentat într-un cadru de campanie politică, lipsit de neutralitatea necesară unui material jurnalistic sau educațional. Efectul electoral este clar, având ca obiectiv creșterea numărului de voturi pentru candidatul menționat.  Datele de contact ale advertiserului sunt contact@sebastiantiberiupop.ro și +40760256257.
</message-for-police>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
